name: Murray Hill Diner
address: 222 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA

reviews.text:
Straight out of a Nora Ephron movieâ€¦

Great Murray Hill Diner! Attentive service, appetizing food, and refills on coffee and water were plentiful.

Will definitely recommend and return.

I had great breakfast at Murray Hill Diner. It is a very classic American diner like in movies. The food was perfect and the people working there were absolutely friendly and helpful. Thank you very much for this experience!

I was charged $28.30 for an egg white greek omelette, toast, and no potatoes.  That was a direct delivery so there were no grubhub fees.  I am accustomed to over paying in Manhattan but this was ridiculous.  I actually called them when I saw this and they didn't care.  Any New Yorker knows that we get burnt omelettes from diners.  I have literally had to learn to eat burnt eggs.  My 89 year old mother complains about this all of the time.  Of course, my egg white omelette was burnt (and I have lowered my standards to survive in Manhattan), but I found it egregious that I was charged this amount of money for egg whites, tomatoes, feta, spinach and two pieces of bread.
Classic diner.  Not fancy.  Solid place.

This diner is exactly what you want in a diner - decent fresh cooked food including 24 hour breakfast options at reasonable prices and served quickly!  Not gourmet or anything fancy- but isnâ€™t that what makes diners great?
Absolut typischer Diner, sehr freundliche Bedienung, leckere Auswahl an FrÃ¼hstÃ¼ck, leckerer Kaffee, definitiv empfehlenswert.
Delicious food.

Part of me wants to keep this place my own secret. What they served was excellent. The staff exhibits warmth likewise. This place has me questioning what others experienced. The exceptional offerings make this place universally appealing.
No me mandaron el pedido de me lo cobraron
Service feels rushed, I feel.like theres an attempt to turn over tables quickly.

Food: 5/5 â€” Everything was fresh and cooked just how I asked. Pancakes fluffy, eggs done right, and coffee always refilled hot.

Service: 5/5 â€” The staff are consistently friendly and attentive without hovering. They really make you feel welcome from the moment you walk in.

Value: 5/5 â€” Prices are fair for Manhattan, especially considering the portions and quality. Great bang for your buck.

Atmosphere: 4.5/5 â€” Old-school diner charm with that classic NYC feel. Comfortable booths, warm lighting, and a relaxed pace.

Location: 5/5 â€” Super convenient spot near the Empire State Building â€” perfect for breakfast before sightseeing or a quick bite afterward.

Overall: 4.8/5 â€” A true neighborhood gem. No frills, just great food, good prices, and kind people. Exactly what a diner should be.
Ein guter Laden zum FrÃ¼hstÃ¼cken. Das Essen war sehr lecker, aber auch nicht gÃ¼nstig. Die Bedienung war sehr freundlich..

Corned beef sandwich anyone? This place makes real good one ğŸ‘Œ Plus, the rest of their diner classics like omelettes, club sandwiches, pancakes, and even salads are solid. In terms of atmosphere, you can expect the usual diner sounds (dishes, people chatting, coffee slurping, etc), a decent amount of natural light because of the windows on two sides, booth seating, and classic diner bar stools. I've only done take-out and dine-in but in both scenarios, they've been very efficient.
Fantastic food & excellent serviceâ€¦everyone so friendly

Murray Hill Diner 222 Lexington 5/6th ave. If you want a simple breakfast try Murray Hill a quaint coffee shop serves fluffy pancakes and sausage links. Scrambled eggs and home frie potatoes and sausage links with whole grain toast hits your palette in the morning.  Give Murray Hill a try if your in the area.

Si vous venez Ã  New-York, prenez le petit dÃ©jeuner ici! Vous ne serez pas dÃ©Ã§u
Excellent

We always have dinner st Murray Hill diner when we visit New York. We  love it! We have special dietary restrictions. The servers are always very understanding and accommodating. The grilled chicken and steamed broccoli are our favorite dinner. The food is delicious and the coffee is excellent.
Employees hardly speak English and are rather rude. Overpriced micro portions. Don't expect to leave well fed unless you pay a ridiculous price.

Service is OK. Food is affordable, considering the location (the heart of Midtown), but I wouldn't recommend this place. Been here a couple times for work meetings and never really enjoyed my meal. Seems like a reliable and low-key spot for longtime locals, who want a quick bite or to catch up w/friends.

I'm disgusted at the way the owner treats the staff. It made me feel so uncomfortable that I could not even eat. I had to say something to the owner but he doesn't care, he said " I haveto control them", just because they had a giggle? The way he shouted at them in front of the whole restaurant, it was just awful. I have my food in a take away box but lost my appetite, I should not have even paid. Please if you go here and you see someone being mistreated, don't be silent and make him understand that this is not normal behavior!
What a great place!  Friendly staff, great food, and immaculate--wish I lived nearby would visit every day!
Quite expensive for a very simple breakfast.

I enjoy this diner!  From the first time we went there for breakfast they have been friendly, really good service, good food cooked to request, and reasonably priced.  A traditional coffee shop!

Located near the Empire State Building itâ€™s an easy walk before or after a visit for a bite to eat in a relaxed atmosphere.

Ganz tolles amerikanisches Diner. Preise in Ordnung, sehr groÃŸe Portionen und es schmeckt richtig gut. Das Personal ist total aufmerksam und freundlich. Wir waren dort mehrmals zum frÃ¼hstÃ¼cken und fanden es sehr angenehm, dass dort nur wenige Touristen, aber viele New Yorker zu Gast waren.

A classic Diner,   I had the BEC and it was decent.  Coffee was hot and strong.  Refills kept coming.

No issue with a final top up in a to go cup either.

A great place! There's nothing like a New York diner. The service here is excellent; they're friendly and so attentive. Food tasted great and came out quickly. A quiet spot where you can have a nice conversation without having to yell over one another. Prices were a little on the high side, but you get what you pay for and this was well worth it! Highly recommend next time you're in the area!
Food good, prices kind of misleading

Coffee was not good. Even a fresh pot was not appealing. Food came out really fast I ordered pancakes and bacon. The bacon was as ordered but my pancakes were not completely cooked. I sat down and within five minutes of ordering I received food. Uncooked food. Not a great experience I had a party of three my food was taken off the bill but for two people I paid $64 dollars and it wasnâ€™t worth the time or money.
I love diner food, especially breakfast and this one was pretty good.
Nothing special about this diner. The food was mediocre kind of bland. The service was kind and quick.
Nice dinner atmosphere for a breakfast/brunch with good food and pleasant and fast service.
This place for breakfast the best!

Enfin un dÃ®ner comme on le veut
Ambiance familiale et calme mÃ©langeant habituÃ©s et touristes connaisseurs
Une bonne adresse !
This is the epitome of a typical American diner. Our brunch food was great. The service could have been better. To their defense, it was a busy mid morning.
Great food, and fast service!  Best diner in the neighborhood
Delicious!

The restaurant has found a formula for creating special experiences. The restaurant offers remarkable value. Employees consistently display authentic warmth. The cuisine was middle-of-the-road. I can't say enough good things.
Excelente atenciÃ³n
Nice food choices, excellent customer experience.

Service was great and attentive. Food came out quick and it was really good. They have good presentation. Lol order a triple decker grilled chicken sandwich with bacon. And they cut it in all 4's with toothpicks to hold in place too cute lol. I wasn't expecting it. Would go back. My mom had breakfast and she really liked it as well! No complaints.
A full service traditional diner with better than average food. Service is quick and friendly. Coffee refills at breakfast are included.

Really quick and easy breakfast at this local spot.
All the classics were on the menu but I went old school with eggs and bacon.
It was good and service was fast and polite.
Will be back!
Overpriced and underwhelming. Bacon was not crispy as requested and I should have ordered scrambled eggs not omelet that cost $30!! Coleslaw was good.
I was very please with this diner.   A solid diner with good food and very reasonable prices.  The staff was very polite and I felt welcome.
The food quality is very poor and itâ€™s overcook edthey overwrite everything
Clean with fast service. Tradional breakfast is done less than perfect. Corn beef was mushy, and toast tasted like store bought bread.
Friendly staff and good atmosphere. Breakfast essentials done well.

De los Ãºltimos restaurantes autÃ©nticos americanos que quedan en Nueva York.
Comida buena y servicio rÃ¡pido, por encima de la media de Manhattan.
Service had been better in recent years.

Fast and classic diner. Enjoyed weekend morning. I asked sunny side with home fries. Food is good and service also good.

We were looking for somewhere to get lunch after a visit to the Empire State Building and this diner was a few blocks away, with excellent reviews.

We went along and had burgers and fries with milkshakes, good food with good service and a very traditional diner feel and pleasant atmosphere with plenty of locals stopping in for something to eat. Highly recommended, so glad we stumbled upon it.

I love this diner!
I've been coming here for a few years, and I really love that they have a huge menu with so many options.
They have a bit of everything. Breakfast, sandwiches, waffles, pancakes, salads, burgers, soups, Greek and Italian dishes... My favorites are the Waffles (starting at $12), the thick chocolate shake ($9), the fresh lemonade ($5), and the pulled pork sandwich ($18).
The servers are all really nice!
Not a bad place for something quick. I was disappointed, many classic diner dishes weren't on the menu. Breakfast would probably be good here.

First diner we went to on our first trip to New York, and was superb. The food was amazing and the service impeccable. We were made to feel very welcome. I had the 3 egg deluxe scrambled and wow!!! The breakfast potatoes were superb!! The guest place we will go on our next visit is this diner!!

Such nice serviceâ€¦owner was engaging and gave the kids a plate of fruit to nibble on while we waited. The fact he knew we were tourists and really didnâ€™t need to made it all the better.
I had eggs and corned beef hash, wife and daughter the avocado dishes and my son the waffles with bacon. All excellent. Coffee good too.
Bill included ~20% service which seemed fair. Will be back next time!

This was probably our best breakfast in New York City. All food was very good surf, quick and friendly, but not too friendly. We had Gyro wrap with chicken was great, not to oily, great size, also with great crispy french fries. Eggs Florentine on spinach with cheese (feta like ?) was very tasty. Also had waffles with maple syrop and bacon. Myself Murray omelette which had lots of meat.
Very good value for money and (!!!) they donâ€™t add up service automatically, which is how it should be. Way to go!

Great little traditional American diner we had waffles (with yoghurt and fresh fruit) and pancakes (with bacon and maple syrup) here on our last day.  Excellent value for money in a city where food can be comically  overpriced,  Food was freshly made, friendly servers and free coffee refills. The customers were all locals with kids or on their way to/from work which is always a  good indication of a being a decent place to go. Tables and condiments were all very clean and so was the bathroom. Highly recommend if you're in the area.

Excellent corner diner. Clean and bright. We were seated immediately; our choice of tables. Service was quick and professional and attentive. Coffee was hot and fresh. Grilled cheese & egg salad sandwiches were delicious; actually the best grilled cheese I have yet to have. Coffee cup remained full, no matter how much I drank. View of Madison Avenue from our table was really nice. And I liked that the owner (or manager) was happy to allow people off the street to use the bathrooms. Which were the sole downside; the bathrooms are not accessible. Two steps up and tiny. Otherwise, a perfect diner experience.

The diner was fairly busy, maybe at 80% capacity, on a December Saturday morning around 9:30am, but service was pretty quick. I counted at least 4 staff in the kitchen and maybe 9 running tables, etc.

Food was decent, the California omelette with avocado and cheese was better than I had expected.

TÃ­pico restaurante americano, como el de pelÃ­culas. Si no has estado antes en uno sorprende bastante la gestiÃ³n del local.
Lo mejor: te pasan dando cafÃ© y agua  todo el rato. Los pancakes muy buenos. El servicio bastante atentos.
A mejorar: la combinaciÃ³n de la quesadilla, todo era carbohidratos. Patata chafada y quesadilla de pollo ( casi no tenÃ­a) bastante seco todo.

Im Murray Hill Diner bekommt man klassisches amerikanisches Essen zu wirklich fairen Preisen â€“ zumindest fÃ¼r New Yorker VerhÃ¤ltnisse. Der Service war freundlich und flink, sodass wir unser FrÃ¼hstÃ¼ck ohne lange Wartezeiten in entspannter AtmosphÃ¤re genieÃŸen konnten.

Super friendly greeter and very quick service. Typical diner atmosphere, and food (less stars). But a very good selection(extensive menu - see pics).
Coffee was hot and plenty of refills. Corn muffins grilled perfect soft center, old time favorite and highly recommended. A bacon egg and cheese on a toasted bun is another classic won't break the bank... My guest had the monti-cristo, the presentation on his dish wasn't the most appetizing however it was nicely stacked with ham and turkey, very tasty and topped off with a thick layer of cheese, w/ syrup drizzled over.
Overall this is a place I have visited a few times and will surely continue to try some other items on the menus. You should too!

Came here on a Sunday morning. No problem getting a seat, and the food came out quick, like 4-6 minutes after order quick. The staff was friendly and quick to service.

I ordered three eggs over easy with a side of bacon and sausages and a coffee. It also came with a smashed potato and toast. The portion was pretty big, but unfortunately, the food had little to no flavor.

For the price (my receipt with tip came out to $30), it was a bit gutting. I'm not sure if I'd try again.

We had a lovely breakfast at Murray Hill Diner's. Wraps (french fries included) and fried eggs with bacon (also with french fries) are worth trying. By ordering a coffee you also get a refill. The place is clean, welcoming and has a big choice of different tables. I love the ones in the corner where I can see New York start the day. Payment by card is possible. Thank you for the american experience- your friends from Europe!
Service was quick and easy. Food was really good.  It's a small diner but we would go there again.

First breakfast of our trip brought us to this diner afew blocks from our hotel.

We were seated immediately and served straight away. We opted for the Sunday brunch which is available from 10am and at $22 per person, was value for money.

Would highly recommend this place if you are visiting and in the area

The service was amazing, food was great.

Get the bison burger and add some cheese. Canâ€™t go wrong.

The atmosphere felt welcoming and at home.
Have just got back home from NY discovered this lovely dinner whilst we were there. Went a couple of times for breakfast and one evening. Lovely food, friendly staff and spotlessly clean.

UPDATE: came here a second time for the benefit of the doubt but this time the same sandwich I ordered the day before (cheese and bacon sandwich) had a complete different preparation. It was just BADâ€¦ ğŸ¥´

Mixed experiences:
Eggs Benedict arrived without ham, the bread was not even toasted. Worst dish Iâ€™ve ever had.

Super fast service but it seems they sacrifice dishes quality. As for the atmosphere, we ate at the bar and you can feel the tension around the kitchen.

Their manager is not organized when dishes come out form the kitchen so everything starts piling upâ€¦
